# D.King__disambig_1

| birth_place  =
| origin       = Crofton, Maryland
| genre        = Hip hop
| alias        = D.King, DK
| occupation   = Rapper
| years_active = 2001–present
| website      =
}}
Justin Essandoh (born November 27, 1983), also known as D.King or DK, is an African rapper, songwriter, and recording artist in the hip hop genre.  The name "D.King" or "DK" is short for "Don and the King".
Early life
Raised in Crofton, Maryland, 'D King' attended an upscale private high school in Severn, Maryland, during which time he attempted rapping.
At the Hip Hop Summit in 2000, which he and a friend snuck into, 'D King' impressed the A & R of Roc-A-Fella Records with a demo tape.
Music career
His career began as a collaborative artist/writer for Trina and Teairra Marie in 2011. He has received critical acclaim from Sway in the morning, [http://2dopeboyz.com/2016/02/13/d-king-bad-trina/ 2dopeboyz], [http://rapradar.com/2014/03/06/new-music-d-king-x-360-never-do/ Rap Radar], [http://www.complex.com/music/2015/11/d-king-new-video-premiere-feat-tate-kobang-light-it-up Complex], [http://earmilk.com/2015/10/15/baltimores-d-king-and-tate-kobang-break-it-down-light-it-up/ Earmilk], and [http://karencivil.com/2014/09/07/civil-selects-mansions-moon-bj-chicago-kid-well/ Karen Civil].
In 2014, he started his own label of songwriters and producers called the 730 Commission and began working on his debut album featuring Snoop Dogg, Trina, Pusha T, and Benny the Butcher. The completed music video for D.King’s first single “Knockaz, featuring Benny the Butcher is slated for release in 2022. This will be followed up by Beautiful Thing featuring Snoop Dogg which hopes to be a blockbuster single, however 'D King' has yet to release an album and has failed to gain any significant success in the music industry. He also has a Revolt TV feature awaiting his official release.
